This document illustrate how to use color in WHeatmap.

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
## library(devtools)
## load_all('~/tools/wheatmap/wheatmap')
```

```{r prepare}
library(wheatmap)
```

# continous color map

Usually wheatmap sets colors automatically
```{r}
WColorBarH(1:10)
```

# discrete color map

Even if you specify the color name, it just ignore them and assign its own colors. One can override by telling WHeatmap the data is color name using the `cmp=CMPar(use.data=T)` option.

```{r}
WColorBarV(rep(c('black','red','blue'),3)) +
  WColorBarV(rep(c('black','red','blue'),3),RightOf(),cmp=CMPar(use.data=T)) +
  WLegendV(NULL, BottomRightOf(h.pad=0.05), height=0.1)
```
